abstract.p: Thomas Trantino, New Jersey's longest-serving prison inmate, is released on parole on his 64th birthday; parole board orders him to live in Camden County despite his request to live in Staten Island, NY (S)

block.p: Thomas Trantino, who was New Jersey's longest-serving inmate, was released on parole last week. Originally sentenced to death for the 1963 killing of two police officers in Lodi, Mr. Trantino had his sentence was changed to life in prison after New Jersey abolished the death penalty in 1972. Released on his 64th birthday, Mr. Trantino had spent more than 38 years in prison, the last year in a halfway house. Although he has applied to live in Staten Island, he is living in a transitional house in Collingwood, based on an order from the state parole board that he live in Camden County.
